episodes.title: Inside Prince Andrew’s Epstein World: What the Files Finally Show
episodes.description:
In this segment, author Andrew Lownie explains how recent Jeffrey Epstein files deepen the picture of Prince Andrew’s closeness to Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. While not entirely new, the documents add sordid detail, reinforce victim testimony, and confirm Andrew’s refusal to cooperate with U.S. investigators as a material witness. Lownie argues royal protection stalled justice, but mounting evidence and public pressure make continued silence increasingly untenable.

Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment.

Subscribe to The Zach Show 2.0 to gain early access to all future episodes, exclusive AMAs, the ability to suggest guest questions, bonus content, and more: https://thezachshow.supercast.com/

episodes.title: Ten Epstein Co-Conspirators — So Why Was No One Charged?
episodes.description:
In this segment, author Andrew Lownie challenges the official claim that Jeffrey Epstein acted alone, pointing to law-enforcement emails citing investigations into ten co-conspirators and grand jury subpoenas. Lownie argues the absence of charges, closure memos, or clearing documentation makes the case appear farcical and sinister, suggesting evidence was withheld or destroyed and warning public pressure may eventually force prosecutions.

Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment.

episodes.title: The DOJ Email That Changes Trump’s Epstein Story
episodes.description:
In this segment, author Andrew Lownie cites a 2020 DOJ email alleging Donald Trump flew multiple times on Jeffrey Epstein’s jet alongside Ghislaine Maxwell and possible witnesses. Lownie argues the evidence of closeness is mounting, questions Maxwell’s favorable prison treatment, and warns the system appears corrupt, suggesting a long-delayed reckoning may finally be approaching.

Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment.

episodes.title: “Release Everything”: Clinton Calls the Epstein Files Bluff
episodes.description:
In this segment, author Andrew Lownie reacts to Bill Clinton publicly daring the full Epstein files to be released, framing it as a defensive show of confidence. Lownie suggests Clinton may have been reckless but not criminal, while warning Donald Trump appears far more deeply entangled. He criticizes DOJ and FBI handling, arguing selective releases can’t hold forever and whistleblowers may force full disclosure.

Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment.

episodes.title: Why the Epstein Files Seem Politically Engineered
episodes.description:
In this segment, author Andrew Lownie argues the latest Jeffrey Epstein files appear politically selective, spotlighting Bill Clinton while minimizing Donald Trump, even as sloppy redactions hint more is coming. Lownie flags overlooked witnesses, including Lynne Forrester de Rothschild, and says sexualized settings and unchaperoned young women warrant subpoenas, warning the dam is breaking and accountability may finally follow.

Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment.

episodes.title: #286 - The Epstein Files 'Christmas Dump': Clinton, Trump, Prince Andrew, & The 10 Co-Conspirators
episodes.description: For years, the Epstein story sat half-exposed and half-buried—until the DOJ quietly released over 40,000 files. In this episode, investigative biographer Andrew Lownie breaks down what actually matters: missing evidence, sanitized redactions, and an investigation that admits to 10 co-conspirators yet charged only one person. From Clinton and Trump to Prince Andrew, the files suggest not incompetence, but protection. Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment. episodes.title: #285 - S*x, Power, Epstein, and the Crown: The Prince Andrew COVERUP | Andrew Lownie
episodes.description: Investigative biographer Andrew Lownie joins the show to unpack the rise and fall of Prince Andrew, from his troubled childhood and war-hero image to financial corruption, Epstein, and royal protection at the highest levels. We explore Andrew’s marriage to Sarah Ferguson, the Trade Envoy scandals, intelligence entanglements, the Virginia Giuffre case, the infamous Newsnight interview, Andrew's and Fergie's relationship to Epstein, and why Lownie believes the monarchy enabled Andrew for decades. Guest bio: Andrew Lownie is an award-winning investigative biographer, journalist, and publisher, widely regarded as one of Britain’s most relentless royal historians. He is the author of Traitor King, The Mountbattens, and his latest book Entitled, which examines Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson. Known for deep archival research and award-winning writing, Lownie has built a reputation for exposing power, corruption, and institutional cover-ups at the highest levels of the British establishment. episodes.title: #198 - Rick Alan Ross: EXPOSING DESTRUCTIVE CULTS, Tom Cruise And Scientology, Deprogramming Followers, Jim Jones, NXIVM, & Is Andrew Tate A Cult Leader?
episodes.description: On this episode of The AUXORO Podcast, Rick Alan Ross and Zach discuss how destructive cults control, manipulate, and sometimes kill their followers, how someone like Tom Cruise could be hooked into Scientology, some of the most effective methods he and other experts have used to reverse cult programming, the rise of Jim Jones and the Jonestown Massacre, coming face to face with Keith Raniere the founder of NXIVM, whether Andrew Tate qualifies as a cult leader, and more. Guest Bio:  Rick Alan Ross is a cult expert and the founder of The Cult Education Institute. He is an internationally known expert regarding destructive cults, controversial groups and movements and author of the book "Cults Inside Out: How People Get In and Can Get Out." Since 1982 he has been studying, researching and responding to the problems often posed by controversial authoritarian groups and movements. BONUS EPISODES & PREMIUM ACCESS: https://auxoro.supercast.com/ RICK ALAN ROSS LINKS:Cults Inside Out: How People Get In and Can Get Out: https://amzn.to/3WXoEluCult Education Institute: https://www.culteducation.com/Twitter: https://bit.ly/3HxF6mCTHE AUXORO PODCAST LINKS:Apple: https://apple.co/3B4fYju Spotify: https://spoti.fi/3zaS6sPOvercast: https://bit.ly/3rgw70DYoutube: https://bit.ly/3lTpJdjWebsite: https://www.auxoro.com/ AUXORO SOCIAL LINKS:Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/auxoroYouTube: https://bit.ly/3CLjEqFFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/auxoromagNewsletter: https://www.auxoro.com/thesourceYouTube: https://bit.ly/3CLjEqF If you enjoy the show, please consider leaving a short review on Apple Podcasts. It takes less than 60 seconds, helps us appear higher in searches so more people discover the show, and it boosts my ego;) Past Guests On The Auxoro Podcast Include: Aubrey de Grey, Andy Weir, Eben Britton, Eric Jorgenson, Isabelle Boemeke, Houston Arriaga, Jerzy Gregorek, Chris Cooper, Gryffin, Elsa Diaz, Dave Robinson, Meghan Daum, FINNEAS, Chloé Valdary, Coleman Hughes, Maziar Ghaderi, YONAS, Ryan Michler, Ryan Meyer, Gavin Chops, Bren Orton, Zuby, Jason Khalipa, Ed Latimore, Jess Glynne, Noah Kahan, Kid Super, Deryck Whibley, and many more.
